item.title: FPGA Tooling on Ubuntu 20.04
item.description: Ubuntu 20.04 (AKA Focal Fossa) includes updated tools and a snappier desktop (hooray). In this post I test common FPGA tools for compatibility with the beta release of Ubuntu 20.04. These tests are in no way exhaustive: I try using the applications as I normally do with an eye to exercising the main functionality. This post is a work-in-progress: follow WillFlux for updates. Verilator Version: Verilator 4.028 2020-02-06 rev v4.

item.title: A Universe in a Box
item.description: Universe on Screen The screen you’re currently looking at is a universe. A little universe with its own space and time. In this article we’ll be exploring what makes a screen tick and creating our own display controller with an FPGA. If you’re new here take a look at What is Project F? Space & Time The smallest area we can control on a screen is the pixel (picture element): this is our quantum of space.
